author: Megan Ellis
title: The world's most 'youthful' cities
text:
The world's most 'youthful' cities Article By: Megan Ellis Tue, 21 Jul 2015 8:24 AM Share Your Email New York City. Credit: pixabay.com/ mpweny 
The 2015 YouthfulCities Global Index has ranked the world's best cities for youth and young adults, with two South African cities making it into the top 50. 
The index considers which cities are the best for youth to work and play in, taking into account factors such as youth population (aged 15 - 29 years), safety, affordability, civic engagement, food and nightlife, digital access and employment. 
Coming in first place, as the most youthful city in the world, is New York City. 
In second place is London, while third place goes to Berlin. 
Two South African cities made it into the top 50 youthful cities - Johannesburg and Durban. 
Johannesburg placed at number 35, beating out the likes of Shanghai, Mumbai and Casablanca. 
Meanwhile Durban placed at number 47, beating out the likes of Dubai, Lagos and Nairobi.
